subject: College Athletics
Football
Halls of Fame
lead_paragraph: Twenty-two years after being released from prison and 11 since he was unemployed and broke, Billy Cannon, an all-American running back and Heisman Trophy winner at Louisiana State, was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame. Joining Cannon, 72, in this year’s Hall of Fame class were Troy Aikman of U.C.L.A. and Thurman Thomas of Oklahoma State, recent inductees into the Pro Football Hall.
